this is why I want to centralize on one platform :wink:
I will personally recommend you don't do that -- I think Zulip works best with dedicated topics as much as possible, even if you split off sometimes.
People expressed concerns with having too many topics on discord and there is a precedent in #t-compiler/performance from what I read
But I agree, topics are nice :+1:
Having a general is also helpful for new people that know slack/discord/whatever :smile:

the way Zulip topics are meant to be used have the consequence that inactive topics will be hidden. Active topic jump up to the top of the topics list.
So I'm not sure we can have a "sticking" topic always visibile. I understand that for people coming from Slack/Discord this can sound confusing
